name: patient_id
description: Unique patient identifier

name: basic_testing_duration_implied
description: Length of time for basic testing, to be consistent with FDA language and other payor policies.

name: patient_age_years_threshold
description: Patient age threshold for noninstitutionalized persons (older than 60 years).

name: patient_sex
description: Patient's biological sex, noting prevalence differences for OAB and incontinence between women and men.

name: fecal_incontinence_diagnosis
description: Diagnosis of chronic involuntary loss of stool (fecal incontinence).

name: bowel_disturbances_diagnosis
description: Presence of bowel disturbances as a risk factor for fecal incontinence.

name: diarrhea_diagnosis
description: Presence of diarrhea as a risk factor for fecal incontinence.

name: rectal_urgency_symptom
description: Presence of rectal urgency as a symptom and risk factor for fecal incontinence.

name: chronic_illness_burden
description: Burden of chronic illness as a risk factor for fecal incontinence.

name: sacral_neuromodulation_procedure
description: Sacral neuromodulation (SNM) delivers nonpainful, electrical pulses to the sacral nerves to modulate reflexes that influence the bladder, sphincter, and pelvic floor to improve or restore function.

name: voiding_dysfunction_diagnosis
description: Diagnosis of voiding dysfunction.

name: urgency_symptom
description: Presence of urgency symptom related to voiding dysfunction.

name: urinary_urge_incontinence_diagnosis
description: Diagnosis of urinary urge incontinence.

name: urgency_frequency_syndrome_diagnosis
description: Diagnosis of urgency-frequency syndrome.

name: nonobstructive_urinary_retention_diagnosis
description: Diagnosis of nonobstructive urinary retention.

name: electrode_array_implantation_procedure
description: Direct stimulation of the sacral nerve(s) via an electrode array implanted at the level of the sacrum.

name: temporary_test_stimulation_procedure
description: Temporary test stimulation to determine if an implantable stimulator would be effective for urinary and fecal incontinence.

name: permanent_stimulator_implantation_procedure
description: Permanent implantation of a stimulator in appropriate candidates after successful temporary test stimulation.

name: refractory_to_conventional_therapy_urinary
description: Patient must be refractory to conventional therapy (documented behavioral, pharmacologic, and/or surgical corrective therapy) for urinary indications.

name: surgical_candidate_status
description: Patient must be an appropriate surgical candidate such that implantation with anesthesia can occur.

name: stress_incontinence_exclusion
description: Exclusion criteria: Patients with stress incontinence.

name: urinary_obstruction_exclusion
description: Exclusion criteria: Patients with urinary obstruction.

name: neurologic_disease_exclusion
description: Exclusion criteria: Patients with specific neurologic disease (e.g., diabetes with peripheral nerve involvement, multiple sclerosis, spinal cord injury) associated with secondary manifestations of incontinence.

name: diabetes_peripheral_nerve_involvement_exclusion
description: Exclusion criteria: Diabetes with peripheral nerve involvement.

name: multiple_sclerosis_exclusion
description: Exclusion criteria: Multiple sclerosis.

name: spinal_cord_injury_exclusion
description: Exclusion criteria: Spinal cord injury.

name: test_stimulation_improvement_percentage_urinary
description: Minimum percentage improvement (50% or greater) required through test stimulation for urinary indications, measured through voiding diaries.

name: voiding_diary_data_recording_ability
description: Patient's ability to demonstrate adequate voiding diary data recording for clinical evaluation of the implant procedure results.

name: fecal_incontinence_episodes_per_week_threshold
description: Minimum average incontinent episodes per week (greater than 2) required for chronic fecal incontinence.

name: fecal_incontinence_duration_months_threshold
description: Minimum duration of fecal incontinence (greater than 6 months).

name: post_vaginal_childbirth_incontinence_duration_months_threshold
description: Minimum duration of incontinence (more than 12 months) after vaginal childbirth.

name: failure_intolerance_conventional_therapy_fecal
description: Documented failure or intolerance to conventional therapy (e.g., dietary modification, bulking, and pharmacologic treatment) for fecal incontinence.

name: percutaneous_test_stimulation_improvement_percentage_fecal
description: Minimum percentage improvement (at least 50% sustained) required for successful percutaneous test stimulation for fecal incontinence.

name: percutaneous_test_stimulation_improvement_duration_hours_fecal
description: Minimum duration of sustained improvement (more than 48 hours) for percutaneous test stimulation for fecal incontinence.

name: anorectal_malformation_absence
description: Absence of anorectal malformation as a condition related to fecal incontinence.

name: congenital_malformation_absence_FI
description: Absence of congenital malformation as a condition related to fecal incontinence.

name: external_anal_sphincter_defect_severity_absence
description: Absence of defects of the external anal sphincter over 60 degrees as a condition related to fecal incontinence.

name: pelvic_radiation_sequelae_absence
description: Absence of visible sequelae of pelvic radiation as a condition related to fecal incontinence.

name: anal_abscesses_fistulae_absence
description: Absence of active anal abscesses and fistulae as a condition related to fecal incontinence.

name: chronic_inflammatory_bowel_disease_absence
description: Absence of chronic inflammatory bowel disease as a condition related to fecal incontinence.

name: peripheral_neuropathy_absence_FI
description: Absence of peripheral neuropathy as a neurologic condition related to fecal incontinence.

name: complete_spinal_cord_injury_absence_FI
description: Absence of complete spinal cord injury as a neurologic condition related to fecal incontinence.

name: chronic_constipation_exclusion
description: Sacral nerve stimulation is considered experimental/investigational for the treatment of chronic constipation.

name: chronic_pelvic_pain_exclusion
description: Sacral nerve stimulation is considered experimental/investigational for the treatment of chronic pelvic pain (CPP).

name: therapeutic_success_FI_reduction_percentage_threshold
description: Threshold for therapeutic success in fecal incontinence: >=50% reduction of incontinent episodes per week at 12 months compared with baseline.

name: therapeutic_success_FI_reduction_duration_months
description: Duration for evaluating therapeutic success in fecal incontinence: 12 months compared with baseline.

name: medical_record_documentation_necessity
description: Requirement for patient's medical record to contain documentation fully supporting medical necessity for services.

name: history_physical_examination_documentation
description: Requirement for documentation of complete history and physical examination (including voiding diaries, urodynamic studies for urinary incontinence).

name: refractory_to_conventional_therapy_documentation
description: Requirement for documentation that patient is refractory to conventional therapy.

name: successful_test_stimulation_documentation
description: Requirement for documentation that patient had a successful test stimulation to support subsequent implantation.
